name: Professor Oak

historicalClassification.note: Originally printed as a Trainer in Base Set. Would be classified as Supporter by modern rules due to powerful hand refresh effect.

effect.text: Discard your hand, then draw 7 cards.

requirements.description: Must have at least 7 cards in deck

antiSynergies: Cards you want to keep in hand
tips: Play out useful cards from hand before using
One of the most powerful draw cards ever printed
Use aggressively early game to find Energy and setup pieces
Before using Oak, play out cards from your hand that you want to use
In the late game, count your deck before Oak to avoid decking yourself

competitiveHistory: Professor Oak is one of the most iconic and powerful cards in Pokemon TCG history. It was an automatic 4-of staple in virtually every competitive Base Set deck. The ability to draw 7 cards with no real downside (discarding is often advantageous) made it indispensable for consistency. Oak defined the aggressive playstyle of early Pokemon TCG, enabling decks like Haymaker to explode out of the gate with turn 1 setups.

rulings.ruling: You must discard your entire hand before drawing the 7 cards
If you have no cards in hand besides Professor Oak, you simply draw 7 cards
You must have at least 7 cards remaining in your deck to play Professor Oak
All cards discarded by Professor Oak go to your discard pile (face-up, public knowledge)
You cannot choose to discard only some cards - it's all or nothing
Cards discarded can be recovered with Energy Retrieval, Item Finder, or similar effects
If an effect prevents you from discarding, you cannot play Professor Oak
Professor Oak counts as playing a Trainer card for effects that track Trainer usage
